intro: Uechtritzia lacei, commonly known as the lacey thistle, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a spiny, shrub-like appearance. Its leaves are covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a silvery appearance. Uechtritzia lacei produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting various pollinators.
